intro: Pingraea articulata, commonly known as the articulated liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is a small, leafy liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive, segmented thallus with a central axis and lateral lobes, giving it its "articulated" appearance. It reproduces via spores, which are released from capsules that develop on the upper surface of its stems. Pingraea articulata is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
